result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik Doel Echevarria was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: P&P to notify the court, in writing, of any arrests w/n 5 days of receipt of information or upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal druggs.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court w/n 30 days & at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Drug Charge.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

03:14 PM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State and County. Defendant, Erik Doel Echevarria, appeared with Attorney David Patton.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF426/22TR2623. Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record.

22CF426:   Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 2-3 are dismissed and read in. Parties request to waive PSI; Court grants request. Sentencing arguments heard. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions. No sentence credit if revoked. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. Court costs, Drug surcharge and DNA surcharge ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.

22TR2623: On County's motion, case is dismissed.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Erik Doel Echevarria, appeared with Attorney David Patton.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF426/22TR2623. Attorney Patton states that the matter is not resolved and is requesting an adjournment due to a discovery issue. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
